docs.title: Description
docs.text: CTXCloudApi is a PowerShell module for Citrix DaaS (CVAD) Manage & Monitor OData APIs. It eliminates the need for the Citrix SDK and provides a single, secure connection via Connect-CTXAPI, after which you can manage and query applications, delivery groups, machine catalogs, hypervisors, sessions, and monitoring data across Citrix Cloud tenants. The module includes robust reporting and export options (Excel/HTML) to support inventory, uptime, failures, utilization, and configuration audits.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
• Install from PowerShell Gallery PS Gallery 
    Install-Module -Name CTXCloudApi -Verbose
  • or run this script to install from GitHub GitHub Repo 
    $CurrentLocation = Get-Item .
$ModuleDestination = (Join-Path (Get-Item (Join-Path (Get-Item $profile).Directory 'Modules')).FullName -ChildPath CTXCloudApi)
git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/smitpi/CTXCloudApi $ModuleDestination 2>&1 | Write-Host -ForegroundColor Yellow
Set-Location $ModuleDestination
git filter-branch --prune-empty --subdirectory-filter Output HEAD 2>&1 | Write-Host -ForegroundColor Yellow
Set-Location $CurrentLocation
  • Then import the module into your session 
    Import-Module CTXCloudApi -Verbose -Force
  • or run these commands for more help and details. 
    Get-Command -Module CTXCloudApi
Get-Help about_CTXCloudApi
    Documentation can be found at: Github_Pages

docs.title: Functions
docs.text:
• Connect-CTXAPI -- Connects to Citrix Cloud and creates required API headers.
  • Get-CTXAPI_Application -- Returns details about published applications (handles pagination).
  • Get-CTXAPI_CloudService -- Returns details about cloud services and subscription.
  • Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog -- Returns high-level configuration changes in the last X days.
  • Get-CTXAPI_DeliveryGroup -- Returns details about Delivery Groups (handles pagination).
  • Get-CTXAPI_Hypervisor -- Returns details about hosting (hypervisor) connections (handles pagination).
  • Get-CTXAPI_LowLevelOperation -- Returns details about low-level configuration changes (more detailed).
  • Get-CTXAPI_Machine -- Returns details about VDA machines (handles pagination).
  • Get-CTXAPI_MachineCatalog -- Returns details about Machine Catalogs (handles pagination).
  • Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -- Collect Monitoring OData for other reports.
  • Get-CTXAPI_ResourceLocation -- Returns cloud Resource Locations.
  • Get-CTXAPI_Session -- Returns details about current sessions (handles pagination).
  • Get-CTXAPI_SiteDetail -- Returns details about your CVAD site.

  • Get-CTXAPI_VDAUptime -- Get-CTXAPI_VDAUptime [-APIHeader] [[-Export] ] [[-ReportPath] ] []

  • Get-CTXAPI_Zone -- Returns Zone details (handles pagination).

  • New-CTXAPI_Machine -- Creates and adds new machines to a Citrix Cloud Delivery Group.
  • New-CTXAPI_Report -- Generate Citrix Cloud monitoring reports in multiple formats (Host, Excel, HTML).
  • Set-CTXAPI_MachinePowerState -- Starts, shuts down, restarts, or logs off Citrix machines via CTX API.
  • Test-CTXAPI_Header -- Checks that the connection is still valid, and the token hasn't expired.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Connects to Citrix Cloud and creates required API headers.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Connect-CTXAPI [-Customer_Id] <String> [-Client_Id] <String> [-Client_Secret] <String>
 [-Customer_Name] <String> [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Authenticates against Citrix Cloud using `Client_Id` and `Client_Secret`, resolves the CVAD `Citrix-InstanceId`, and constructs headers for subsequent CTXCloudApi requests. Returns a `CTXAPIHeaderObject` containing `CustomerName`, `TokenExpireAt` (about 1 hour), `CTXAPI` (ids), and `headers`.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
$splat = @{

Customer_Id = "xxx" Client_Id = "xxx-xxx-xxx-xxx" Client_Secret = "yyyyyy==" Customer_Name = 'HomeLab' } $APIHeader = Connect-CTXAPI @splat

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Connect-CTXAPI -Customer_Id "xxx" -Client_Id "xxx-xxx" -Client_Secret "yyyyyy==" -Customer_Name "Prod"

Creates and returns a `CTXAPIHeaderObject`. Store it in a variable (e.g., `$APIHeader`) and pass to other cmdlets.

docs.title: -Customer_Id
docs.text:
Citrix Customer ID (GUID) from the Citrix Cloud console.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Parameter Sets: (All)

Accept wildcard characters: False

Required: True

Accept wildcard characters: False

Type: String

Accept pipeline input: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Returns details about published applications (handles pagination).

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Get-CTXAPI_Application [-APIHeader] <Object> [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Returns details about published applications from Citrix Cloud CVAD.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_Application -APIHeader $APIHeader | Select-Object Name, Enabled, NumAssociatedDeliveryGroups

Lists application names, enabled state, and associated delivery group count.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_Application -APIHeader $APIHeader | Where-Object Enabled | Select-Object Name

Shows only enabled applications.

docs.title: -APIHeader
docs.text:
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.

Type: Object
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: CommonParameters
docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters.

docs.title: None. Parameters are not accepted from the pipeline.
Array of application objects returned from the CVAD Manage API.
RELATED LINKS

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Returns details about cloud services and subscription.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Get-CTXAPI_CloudService [-APIHeader] <Object> [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Returns details about Citrix Cloud services and subscription state from the `serviceStates` endpoint.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_CloudService -APIHeader $APIHeader | Select-Object serviceName, state, lastUpdated

Lists each service name, its current state, and the last update time.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_CloudService -APIHeader $APIHeader | Where-Object { $_.state -ne 'Enabled' }

Shows services that are not currently enabled.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Returns high-level configuration changes in the last X days.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog [-APIHeader] <Object> [-Days] <String> [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Returns high-level configuration changes over the past X days from the Config Log Operations endpoint.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog -APIHeader $APIHeader -Days 15 | Select-Object TimeStamp, ObjectType, OperationType, User

Shows recent configuration operations with key fields for the past 15 days.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog -APIHeader $APIHeader -Days 7 | Where-Object { $_.ObjectType -eq 'DeliveryGroup' }

Filters operations related to Delivery Groups in the last 7 days.

Aliases:

Required: True

Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 2
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Returns details about low-level configuration changes (more detailed).

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text: Get-CTXAPI_LowLevelOperation [-APIHeader] <Object> [-HighLevelID] <String> [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Returns details about low-level configuration changes for a specific operation ID from Config Log.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
$ConfigLog = Get-CTXAPI_ConfigLog -APIHeader $APIHeader -Days 7

$LowLevelOperations = Get-CTXAPI_LowLevelOperation -APIHeader $APIHeader -HighLevelID $ConfigLog[0].id Retrieves low-level operations for the first high-level operation in the past 7 days.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
" | Select-Object OperationType, Property, OldValue, NewValue

Shows key fields for each low-level change.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Collect Monitoring OData for other reports.

docs.title: hours
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -APIHeader <Object> [-LastHours <Int32>] [-MonitorDetails <String[]>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: specific
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -APIHeader <Object> [-BeginDate <DateTime>] [-EndDate <DateTime>]
 [-MonitorDetails <String[]>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Collects Citrix Monitor OData entities for a specified time window and returns a composite object used by reporting cmdlets.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
$MonitorData = Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -APIHeader $APIHeader -LastHours 24

Collects the last 24 hours of Monitor OData and returns a CTXMonitorData object.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -APIHeader $APIHeader -BeginDate (Get-Date).AddDays(-2) -EndDate (Get-Date).AddDays(-1) -MonitorDetails Connections,Session

Collects data for a specific date range and includes only Connections and Session entities.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData -APIHeader $APIHeader -LastHours 48 | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Connections

Expands and lists connection records for the past 48 hours.

docs.title: -APIHeader
docs.text:
Header object created by Connect-CTXAPI; contains authentication and request headers.

Type: Object
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -LastHours
docs.text:
Relative time window in hours (e.g., 24, 48). When specified, BeginDate is now and EndDate is now minus LastHours.

Type: Int32
Parameter Sets: hours
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: 0
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -BeginDate
docs.text:
Start of the time window when specifying an explicit range.

Type: DateTime
Parameter Sets: specific
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -EndDate
docs.text:
End of the time window when specifying an explicit range.

Type: DateTime
Parameter Sets: specific
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -MonitorDetails
docs.text:
One or more OData entity names to include. Default is All.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: All
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text: This cmdlet supports the common parameters: -Debug, -ErrorAction, -ErrorVariable, -InformationAction, -InformationVariable, -OutVariable, -OutBuffer, -PipelineVariable, -Verbose, -WarningAction, and -WarningVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters.

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Creates and adds new machines to a Citrix Cloud Delivery Group.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
New-CTXAPI_Machine [-APIHeader] <Object> [-MachineCatalogName] <String> [-DeliveryGroupName] <String>
 [-AmountOfMachines] <Int32> [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: This function provisions one or more new machines in a specified Machine Catalog and adds them to a specified Delivery Group in Citrix Cloud using the CTXCloudApi module. The function supports verbose output for detailed process tracking.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
New-CTXAPI_Machine -APIHeader $header -MachineCatalogName "Win10-Catalog" -DeliveryGroupName "Win10-Users" -AmountOfMachines 2 -Verbose

Creates 2 new machines in the "Win10-Catalog" Machine Catalog and adds them to the "Win10-Users" Delivery Group, showing verbose output.

docs.title: -APIHeader
docs.text:
The authentication header object returned by Connect-CTXAPI, required for all API calls.

Type: Object
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

The name of the Machine Catalog where new machines will be created.

Aliases:

Required: True

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -DeliveryGroupName
docs.text:
The name of the Delivery Group to which the new machines will be added.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 3
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text:
The number of machines to create and add to the Delivery Group.

Aliases:

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Generate Citrix Cloud monitoring reports in multiple formats (Host, Excel, HTML).

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
New-CTXAPI_Report -APIHeader <Object> [-MonitorData <Object>] [-LastHours <Int32>] -ReportType <String[]>
 [-Export <String>] [-ReportPath <DirectoryInfo>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: New-CTXAPI_Report generates detailed Citrix Cloud monitoring reports, including resource utilization, connection activity, connection failures, and machine failures. The function can output reports to the host, export to Excel, or create a styled HTML report with embedded branding. Data can be sourced from a provided MonitorData object or fetched live via API.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
New-CTXAPI_Report -APIHeader $header -ReportType All -Export HTML -ReportPath C:\Reports

Generates all available reports and exports them as a styled HTML file to C:\Reports.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
New-CTXAPI_Report -APIHeader $header -ReportType ResourceUtilization -Export Excel

Exports only the resource utilization report to Excel in the default temp directory.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
New-CTXAPI_Report -APIHeader $header -MonitorData $data -ReportType ConnectionReport

Outputs the connection report to the host using pre-fetched monitoring data.

docs.title: -APIHeader
docs.text:
The authentication header object for Citrix Cloud API requests. Required for all operations.

Type: Object
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -MonitorData
docs.text:
Optional. Pre-fetched monitoring data object. If not provided, the function retrieves data using Get-CTXAPI_MonitorData.

Type: Object
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -LastHours
docs.text:
Optional. Number of hours of historical data to include (default: 24). Used only if MonitorData is not provided.

Type: Int32
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: 24
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -ReportType
docs.text:
Specifies which report(s) to generate. Valid values: ConnectionReport, ResourceUtilization, ConnectionFailureReport, MachineFailureReport, All.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Export
docs.text:
Specifies the output format. Valid values: Host (default), Excel, HTML.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: Host
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -ReportPath
docs.text:
Directory path for exported reports (Excel/HTML). Defaults to $env:TEMP. Must exist.

Type: DirectoryInfo
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: $env:temp
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Starts, shuts down, restarts, or logs off Citrix machines via CTX API.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Set-CTXAPI_MachinePowerState [-APIHeader] <Object> [-Name <String[]>] [-PowerAction <String>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: This function allows you to remotely control the power state of Citrix machines using the CTX API. You can start, shut down, restart, or log off one or more machines by specifying their name, DNS name, or ID.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Set-CTXAPI_MachinePowerState -APIHeader $header -Name "CTX-Machine01" -PowerAction Start

Starts the specified Citrix Machine.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Set-CTXAPI_MachinePowerState -APIHeader $header -Name "CTX-Machine01","CTX-Machine02" -PowerAction Shutdown

Shuts down multiple Citrix Machines.

docs.title: -APIHeader
docs.text:
The CTX API authentication header object (type CTXAPIHeaderObject) required for API calls.

Type: Object
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Name
docs.text:
The name, DNS name, or ID of the Citrix Machine(s) to target. Accepts an array of strings.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: DNSName, Id

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -PowerAction
docs.text:
The desired power action to perform. Valid values: Start, Shutdown, Restart, Logoff.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
